spending: State and local dollars spent on K–12 education per state resident
demographics: Children who could be in school as a share of state population
eligibility: Children who are enrolled in school as a share of children who could be in school
takeup: Children who attend public school as a share of children in school
units: Public school employees per child in public school
payroll: Dollars spent on wages and salaries per school employee
nonpayroll: Dollars spent on facilities and other costs per school employee

spending: State and local dollars spent on higher education per state resident
demographics: 18- to 24-year-olds in the state as a share of state population
eligibility: Students enrolled in college in the state as a share of 18- to 24-year-olds
takeup: Students enrolled in public colleges in the state as a share of college students
units: College employees per student in public colleges
payroll: Dollars spent on wages and salaries per college employee
nonpayroll: Dollars spent on nonpersonnel costs per college employee

spending: State and local dollars spent on highways per state resident
demographics: People old enough to drive as a share of state population
eligibility: State residents with a driver’s license as a share of the driving-age population
takeup: Average number of miles each driver in the state drives
units: Miles of highway per mile driven
payroll: Dollars spent on wages and salaries per mile of road
nonpayroll: Dollars spent on nonpersonnel costs per mile of road

spending: State and local dollars spent on public transit per state resident
demographics: Average number of public transit trips a state resident takes
eligibility: Any state resident could use public transit, so the entire population is eligible
takeup: Average length, in miles, of a public transit trip in the state
units: Miles of transit infrastructure per mile traveled on transit
payroll: Dollars spent on wages and salaries per mile of bus or train routes
nonpayroll: Dollars spent on nonpersonnel costs per mile of bus or train routes

spending: State and local dollars spent on police per state resident
demographics: Any state resident could benefit from police protection, so the entire population is potentially eligible
eligibility: Any state resident could benefit from police protection, so the entire population is eligible
payroll: Dollars spent on wages and salaries per police employee
nonpayroll: Dollars spent on nonpersonnel police costs per police employee

spending: Local dollars spent on fire protection per state resident
demographics: Any state resident could benefit from fire protection services, so the entire population is potentially eligible
eligibility: Any state resident could benefit from fire protection services, so the entire population is eligible
takeup: All state residents could benefit from fire protection services
payroll: Dollars spent on wages and salaries per fire employee
nonpayroll: Dollars spent on nonpersonnel fire protection costs per fire employee

spending: State and local dollars spent on corrections per state resident
demographics: Any state resident could be under correctional supervision, so the entire population is potentially eligible
eligibility: Any state resident could be under correctional supervision, so the entire population is eligible
takeup: People under correctional supervision as a share of state population
units: Corrections employees per prisoner or parolee
payroll: Dollars spent on wages and salaries per corrections employee
nonpayroll: Dollars spent on nonpersonnel corrections costs per corrections employee

spending: State and local dollars spent on Medicaid per state resident
demographics: People living at or below 200% of the federal poverty level as a share of state population
eligibility: Low-income people eligible for Medicaid under state and federal rules as a share of state low-income population
spending-per: Dollars spent on Medicaid and CHIP per recipient

spending: State and local dollars spent on TANF per state resident
demographics: People living at or below 200% of the federal poverty level with children as a share of state population
eligibility: Low-income people eligible for TANF based on state rules as a share of state low-income population with children
takeup: TANF recipients as a share of eligible state residents
spending-per: Dollars spent on TANF per recipient

spending: State and local dollars spent on CCDF per state resident
demographics: People living at or below 200% of the federal poverty level with children as a share of state population
eligibility: Number of residents eligible under state CCDF rules per low-income resident with children
takeup: CCDF recipients as a share of eligible state residents
spending-per: Dollars spent on CCDF per recipient

spending: State and local dollars spent on housing per state resident
demographics: People living at or below 200% of the federal poverty level as a share of state population
eligibility: We do not have eligibility information for the diverse range of housing programs
takeup: Housing support recipients as a share of low-income state residents
units: Housing employees per resident receiving housing support
payroll: Dollars spent on wages and salaries per housing employee
nonpayroll: Dollars spent on nonpersonnel housing costs per housing employee

spending: State and local dollars spent on parks per state resident
demographics: Any state resident could visit a state park, so the entire population is potentially eligible
eligibility: Any state resident could visit a state park, so the entire population is eligible
takeup: Any state resident could use state parks
payroll: Dollars spent on wages and salaries per parks employee
nonpayroll: Dollars spent on nonpersonnel park costs per park employee

spending: State and local dollars spent on natural resources per state resident
demographics: Any state resident could benefit from natural resources, so the entire population is potentially eligible
eligibility: Any state resident could benefit from natural resources,  so the entire population is eligible
takeup: Any state resident could benefit from state natural resource programs
units: Natural resources employees per state resident
payroll: Dollars spent on wages and salaries per natural resources employee
nonpayroll: Dollars spent on nonpersonnel natural resources costs per natural resources employee

spending: State and local dollars spent on administration per state resident
demographics: Any state resident could benefit from administrative services, so the entire population is potentially eligible
eligibility: Any state resident could benefit from administrative services, so the entire population is eligible
takeup: Any state resident could use government administrative services
payroll: Dollars spent on wages and salaries per administrative employee
nonpayroll: Dollars spent on nonpersonnel administrative costs per administrative employee

spending: State and local dollars spent on gas utilities per state resident
demographics: Any state resident could receive gas services, so the entire population is potentially eligible
eligibility: Any state resident could receive gas services, so the entire population is eligible
takeup: As of publication, we did not have detailed data on gas utility customers
payroll: Dollars spent on wages and salaries per gas employee
nonpayroll: Dollars spent on nonpersonnel gas costs per gas employee

spending: State and local dollars spent on water utilities per state resident
demographics: Any state resident could use water services, so the entire population is potentially eligibile
eligibility: Any state resident could use water services, so the entire population is eligibile
takeup: As of publication, we did not have detailed data on water utility customers
payroll: Dollars spent on wages and salaries per water employee
nonpayroll: Dollars spent on nonpersonnel water costs per water employee

spending: State and local dollars spent on electric utilities per state resident
demographics: Any state resident could use electricity services, so the entire population is potentially eligible
eligibility: Any state resident could use electricity services, so the entire population is eligible
takeup: As of publication, we did not have detailed data on public electricity utility customers
payroll: Dollars spent on wages and salaries per electric employee
nonpayroll: Dollars spent on nonpersonnel electric costs per electric employee

spending: State and local dollars spent on solid waste management per state resident
demographics: Any state resident could use solid waste services, so the entire population is potentially eligible
eligibility: Any state resident could use solid waste services, so the entire population is eligible
takeup: As of publication, we did not have detailed data on solid waste customers
payroll: Dollars spent on wages and salaries per waste employee
nonpayroll: Dollars spent on nonpersonnel waste costs per waste employee

spending: State and local dollars spent on sewerage per state resident
demographics: Any state resident could use sewerage services, so the entire population is potentially eligible
eligibility: Any state resident could use sewerage services, so the entire population is eligible
takeup: As of publication, we did not have detailed data on sewerage customers
payroll: Dollars spent on wages and salaries per sewerage employee
nonpayroll: Dollars spent on nonpersonnel sewerage costs per sewerage employee
